# Child Care Center Licensing Overview (2026)

## Types of Licensed Centers

### Infant Centers
- Ages: Birth to 2 years
- Staff ratio: 1:4 (one adult per 4 infants)
- Higher requirements for caregiver training

### Preschool/Child Care Centers
- Ages: 2-5 years
- Staff ratio: 1:12 (varies by age)
- Can serve full-day or part-day

### School-Age Programs
- Ages: 5-12 years (or 13 with special needs)
- Staff ratio: 1:14
- Often before/after school

## Licensing Agency

**Community Care Licensing Division (CCLD)**
- California Department of Social Services
- Conducts inspections and issues licenses
- Investigates complaints

## What Parents Should Know

### Checking a License

**Online search:** https://www.ccld.dss.ca.gov/carefacilitysearch//carefacilitysearch/

You can find:
- License status (active, pending, revoked)
- Facility capacity
- Inspection reports
- Complaints and citations

### Minimum Standards All Centers Must Meet

**Staff Requirements:**
- Background checks for all staff
- Minimum age 18
- Training requirements (varies by position)
- CPR and First Aid certification

**Health and Safety:**
- Safe indoor and outdoor environments
- Fire safety compliance
- Emergency procedures
- Proper food handling
- Medication policies

**Program Requirements:**
- Age-appropriate activities
- Supervision at all times
- Written policies for parents
- Incident reporting

## Title 22 vs Title 5

### Title 22 (Basic License)
- Minimum licensing standards
- Required for all licensed centers
- Administered by CCLD

### Title 5 (State Contracts)
- Higher quality standards
- Required for state-funded programs (CSPP, CCTR)
- Lower staff-child ratios
- Higher staff qualifications
- Administered by CDE

## Inspection Information

**Inspections include:**
- Unannounced visits
- Review of records
- Physical facility check
- Staff qualifications review
- Observation of care

**Results are public** - you can request inspection reports

## Complaints

**To file a complaint:**
- Call: 1-844-538-8766 (LIC-WARN)
- Online: www.ccld.dss.ca.gov/carefacilitysearch/

**Investigated issues:**
- Health and safety concerns
- Abuse or neglect allegations
- Licensing violations
- Ratio violations

## Questions to Ask Centers

1. What is your license status?
2. When was your last inspection?
3. What is your staff turnover rate?
4. What is your staff-to-child ratio?
5. How do you handle emergencies?
6. Can I see your parent handbook?

**Verify License:** https://www.ccld.dss.ca.gov/carefacilitysearch//carefacilitysearch/
